document_data.name: Mug
document_data.mainbody: '''Mugs''' were a variety of large drinking vessel in the Realm. They were typically used to drink hot or warm beverages, such as [[coffee]] or [[tea]], and served as an improvised weapon in many a tavern brawl.<ref>
document_data.Description: Mugs were made in a variety of materials, including bones, shells, such as [[brass]], [[pewter]], or most expensively [[silver]]. They were always thick and heavy, with most sporting a handle.

Varieities.Tall Mugs: Otherwise known as flagons or steins, were a variety of mug typically used to hold [[ale]].

Notable Users.General:
* Throughout much of the Realms, [[beer]] was typically sold in mugs. 
* Rural taverns often served their regular clientele [[ale]] in mugs, saving their [[tankard]]s for strangers, though customers never used the word "mug" when ordering. Rather, they would simply ask for "an ale."{{Cite web/theedverse/2021-12-03 - Mugs & Tankards in the Realms}}
* Unlike upscale eateries, which would serve it in bowls, taverns often served [[soup]] in mugs.
* The beverage [[Wyrmwizz]] was often sold in mugs.
Notable Users.Businesses:
* The [[Ashabenford Arms]].<ref>
* The [[Black Blade and Bloody Boar]], a tavern in [[Mulmaster]], served its patrons watered-down ale in mugs.{{Cite adventurers league/City of Danger|13-15}}
* The [[Bloody Fist]], a tavern in [[Waterdeep]], used to serve its patrons in mugs made of ceramic, glass, and metal. But as the establishment became more rowdy overtime, it downgraded to simple wooden mugs.
* The [[Elfsong Tavern]] served its patrons stew in mugs.
* The [[Ferryman's Folly]], a tavern in [[Wright's Ferry]].<ref>
* The [[Falcon's Rest]], an inn in [[Arabel]], served its patrons broth in mugs.
* [[Findlewulf's Galley]], a tavern in [[Skullport]], served its patrons beer in mugs.
* [[Gunderman Brewery]].<ref>
* The [[Inn of the Clowns]].<ref>
* The [[Inn of the Dripping Dagger]] served its patrons ale in mugs.<ref>
* The [[Inn of the Five Crowns]] served its patrons beer within mugs.<ref>
* The [[Moonstone Mask]] served its patrons both ale and [[cider]] within mugs.
* The [[Oak and Spear]], an inn in [[Highmoon]], served its patrons beer in mugs.<ref>
* The [[Oxpit Tavern]] served it patrons ale in mugs.
* [[The Raging Lion]] served its patrons cheap spiced [[wine]] in mugs.
* [[The Ram and Duck]] utilized mugs.
* [[The Rising Moon (inn)|The Rising Moon]], an inn in Highmoon, served its beverages in mugs.<ref>
* The [[Smilin' Boar]], a restaurant in [[Baldur's Gate]], used mugs shaped like the head of a [[pig]] to serve their patrons coffee or tea.
* The [[Three Old Kegs]] served its patrons broth in mugs.
Notable Users.Regions & Settlements:
* In the [[Battledale]] region, potteries used blue clay found at the stretch of the [[River Ashaba]] south of [[Yevenwood]] to make a variety of mugs that they sold in both [[Sembia]] and neighboring regions of the [[Dalelands]].
* In the city of [[Berdusk]], most tankard houses offered their patrons hot broth or stew in mugs.
* In the [[Chultan Peninsula]], one could find the beverage [[tej]] being sold in mugs in both [[Fort Beluarian]] and [[Port Nyanzaru]].

document_data.Trivia: Mugs were the namesake for a few businesses in the realms, including [[Azuth's Mug]],{{Cite web enhancement/City of Wyrmshadows|9}} the [[Adamantine Mug]], and the [[Foaming Mug]].
